data.message: I would like to untag a very vile picture that was tagged on my grandson's page by a schoolmate of his.  I referred it to Face Book for review.

replies.message: Hey Debra. You can untag a photo in 5 easy steps. Learn how in our Help Center: https://www.facebook.com/help/www/140906109319589. -Sarah
I want to emphasize that it is not my page.  It is my grandson's page that I want to untag.  Can I still do it?
Debra Adams, you can untag yourself from photos but if you are trying to untag your grandchild, (you, parents or him)would have to be logged into his account to untag him.
So Facebook how can I get you to fix a friends hijacked page and stop seeing offensive posts on their page?!?!?!?
